0.name: Midnight Thicket
desc: "  Amongst the tangles of and snarls of the dense underbrush you see a
small hole. Desperate for any escape from the surrounding suffocating
darkness, you warily get down on your knees to examine the hole closer.
In the dim, shadowy light you sense that the hole might lead somewhere.
Suddenly! A small rabbit bolts past your nose. It seems that you are not
the only one who is a bit edgy being here.

1.name: The Warren
desc: You crawl through the hole and find yourself in a smallish earthen cave
burrowed underneath enormous roots from what are very likely ancient
trees and shrubs. The roots form ominous looking shadows. For a moment
you could have sworn you saw a grizzled troll just poking his nose
around.the corner, but gathering up what's left of your courage you
convince yourself that trolls are only something your big sister used to
scare you with when you were a toddler.
In a corner of the warren, you see a small pile of leaves and and fur.
It is probably where a small animal lives. Opposite the nest you see a
hole which might facilitate your escape.

2.name: The Hole
desc: Moving through the hole, you find yourself in the center of what was
once a majestic oak. Now after more than five hundred years of growing
it has finally died and rotted away from the inside. Luckily for you,
this hollow in the dead oak seems to be a nice safe shelter to rest in.
That is, if you could get over the stench of rotting moldy wood.

3.name: Forest
desc: As you wander aimlessly through the forest, an old dead oak attracts
your ever vigilant attention. Towering high above you, the once grand
oak's branches seem to creak dangerously in the wind. Remembering that
oak is a particularly hard wood (a lesson you learned in school every
time you had your knuckles whacked) you hastily investigate the tree
further. About a yard from the forest floor there is a large hole in
the oak. If you squeeze your body just right, you will be able to enter.
